trans-unit.source: Provides a default implementation of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService"></xref> interface.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService> class is a partial implementation of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> interface.
To use this implementation you must derive from this class and implement the abstract methods.
Once implemented, you may add this class to your designer application's service container.
There should be one toolbox service for each designer application.
<xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService> provides much of the complex logic of creating a toolbox service, but requires that you define the storage containers for categories and items.
This allows for simple toolboxes or very complex ones.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService"></xref> class.
Gets a collection of strings depicting available categories of the toolbox.
The category names correspond to various toolbox categories.
If a toolbox does not implement any form of categories, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.CategoryNames%2A> property may return an empty collection.
A collection of category names.
Creates a new toolbox item container from a saved data object.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.CreateItemContainer%2A> method gives you the opportunity to provide a derived version of a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer>.
By default, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService> class does not support linked items, so it returns `null` for link parameters that are not `null`.
To provide link support, you should override this method to create a derived <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> that is capable of handling links.

The data object passed in should contain data obtained from a prior call to the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.ToolboxData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property on a toolbox item container.
A data object containing saved toolbox data.
A new toolbox item container.
dataObject is `null`.
Creates a new toolbox item container from a toolbox item.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.CreateItemContainer%2A> method gives you the opportunity to provide a derived version of a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer>.
By default, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService> class does not support linked items, so it returns `null` for link parameters that are not `null`.
To provide link support, you should override this method to create a derived <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> that is capable of handling links.
If the provided <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost> link parameter is assigned, it indicates that this is a linked toolbox item.
The toolbox item for which to create an item container.
An optional designer host that should be linked to this toolbox item.
This parameter can be `null`.
A new toolbox item container.
item is `null`.
Occurs when the toolbox service detects that the active designerâ€™s toolbox item filter has changed.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> containing all items on the toolbox.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> containing all items on the toolbox.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> containing all items in a given category.
If the category specified by the `categoryName` parameter does not exist, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetItemContainers%2A> method should throw a meaningful exception.
The category for which to retrieve the item container list.
An containing all items in the category specified by categoryName.
Returns a toolbox item for a given type.
The type of component for which to retrieve the toolbox item.
A toolbox item associated with the given type, or `null` if the type has no corresponding toolbox item.
toolType is `null`.
Returns a toolbox item for a given type.
The type of component for which to retrieve the toolbox item.
`true` to search for non-public constructors on the type; `false` to search for public constructors.
A toolbox item associated with the given type, or `null` if the type has no corresponding toolbox item.
toolType is `null`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> objects for the given assembly.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method scans the assembly for all types that support toolbox items, and return items for those types.
To support a toolbox item, a type must have the following characteristics:
Be public.
Implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent>.
Not be abstract.
Not have a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemAttribute> set to `false` on its type.
Not contain generic parameters.
Assemblies are locked for the duration of a process, so enumerating various files through <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> can cause many assemblies to be loaded.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> methods that take an assembly name create a separate <xref:System.AppDomain> to search assemblies.

When you are finished enumerating <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects for a set of assemblies, you can call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.UnloadToolboxItems%2A> method, which unloads the <xref:System.AppDomain> and frees the file references on the loaded assemblies.
The assembly to enumerate.
A string that is the URL location of the assembly.
`true` to throw an exception on error; otherwise, `false`.
A collection containing all the toolbox items in the assembly represented by the given assembly name.
a is `null`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> objects for the given assembly.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method scans the assembly for all types that support toolbox items, and return items for those types.
To support a toolbox item, a type must have the following characteristics:
Be public.
Implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent>.
Not be abstract.
Not have a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemAttribute> set to `false` on its type.
Not contain generic parameters.
Assemblies are locked for the duration of a process, so enumerating various files through <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> can cause many assemblies to be loaded.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> methods that take an assembly name create a separate <xref:System.AppDomain> to search assemblies.

When you are finished enumerating <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects for a set of assemblies, you can call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.UnloadToolboxItems%2A> method, which unloads the <xref:System.AppDomain> and frees the file references on the loaded assemblies.
An assembly name from which to load an assembly.
`true` to throw an exception on error; otherwise, `false`.
A collection containing all the toolbox items in the assembly represented by the given assembly name.
an is `null`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> objects for the given assembly.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method scans the assembly for all types that support toolbox items, and return items for those types.
To support a toolbox item, a type must have the following characteristics:
Be public.
Implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent>.
Not be abstract.
Not have a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemAttribute> set to `false` on its type.
Not contain generic parameters.
Assemblies are locked for the duration of a process, so enumerating various files through <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> can cause many assemblies to be loaded.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> methods that take an assembly name create a separate <xref:System.AppDomain> to search assemblies.

When you are finished enumerating <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects for a set of assemblies, you can call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.UnloadToolboxItems%2A> method, which unloads the <xref:System.AppDomain> and frees the file references on the loaded assemblies.
Assemblies loaded in this manner are loaded into a separate <xref:System.AppDomain> so they can later be unloaded.
This only momentarily locks the assembly file.
An assembly name from which to load an assembly.
A collection containing all the toolbox items in the assembly represented by the given assembly name.
an is `null`.
Returns an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> containing all the toolbox items in the given assembly.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> method scans the assembly for all types that support toolbox items, and return items for those types.
To support a toolbox item, a type must have the following characteristics:
Be public.
Implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent>.
Not be abstract.
Not have a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemAttribute> set to `false` on its type.
Not contain generic parameters.
Assemblies are locked for the duration of a process, so enumerating various files through <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> can cause many assemblies to be loaded.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems%2A> methods that take an assembly name create a separate <xref:System.AppDomain> to search assemblies.

When you are finished enumerating <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects for a set of assemblies, you can call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.UnloadToolboxItems%2A> method, which unloads the <xref:System.AppDomain> and frees the file references on the loaded assemblies.
The assembly to enumerate.
A string that is the URL location of the assembly.
A collection containing all the toolbox items in the given assembly.
a is `null`.
Returns a value indicating whether the given data object represents an item container.
The data object may directly represent an item container, or there may be a custom toolbox creator that is registered to handle the format contained within the data object.
If the `host` parameter is a valid designer host, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.IsItemContainer%2A> method searches toolbox item creators that are associated with the designer host.
If `host` is supplied, toolbox item creators that are associated with the host are also compared.
The data object to examine for the presence of a toolbox item container.
An optional designer host.
This parameter can be `null`.
`true` if the given data object represents an item container; otherwise, `false`.
dataObject is `null`.
Determines whether the toolbox item container is supported by the given designer host.
The toolbox item container.
The given designer host.
`true` if the toolbox item container is supported by the given designer host; otherwise, `false`.
container or host is `null`.
Refreshes the state of the toolbox items.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService.Refresh%2A> method is called by the toolbox service when a user has requested that the collection of items should be refreshed.
If the collection is always current, there is no need to provide any implementation here.

If the collection returned from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetItemContainers%2A> represents a snapshot of the toolbox items, however, this method provides an opportunity to update them.
Gets or sets the name of the currently selected category.
In general, toolbox items are grouped into categories.
A string containing the name of the currently selected category.
Gets or sets the currently selected item container.
The item container for the currently selected toolbox item, or `null` if no item is selected.
Receives a call from the toolbox service when a user reports that a selected toolbox item has been used.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.SelectedItemContainerUsed%2A> method is called by the toolbox service when a user reports that the selected toolbox item has been used.
After invoking a toolbox item, it is a common user interface (UI) behavior to cancel the selection of that toolbox item.
The default implementation of this method cancels the selection of the toolbox item by setting the selected item container to `null`.
Sets the current application's cursor to a cursor that represents the currently selected tool.
The toolbox service provides support for setting the user interface (UI) cursor to an image that represents the currently selected toolbox item.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.SetCursor%2A> method can be called to set the cursor.
It returns `true` if the cursor is set, or `false` if it is not.
The default implementation sets the cursor to a crosshair and returns `true` if there is an item selected.
It returns `false` and leaves the cursor unchanged if no item is selected.
`true` if there is an item selected; otherwise, `false`.
Unloads any assemblies that were locked as a result of calling the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService.GetToolboxItems*"></xref> method.
Gets the list of available component types.
The designer host providing design-time services.
The base type specifying the components to retrieve.
Can be `null`.
The list of available component types.

It can be used only when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxService> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> interface.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback"></xref> that can create a component when the toolbox item is invoked.
The data format that the creator handles.

This member is an explicit interface member implementation.

The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that the selected tool must be associated with for it to be returned.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> that is currently selected, or `null` if no toolbox item is currently selected.
Gets a collection of toolbox items from the toolbox that match the specified category.
The toolbox item category from which to retrieve all the toolbox items.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified category.
host is `null`.
Gets the collection of toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host and category from the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to retrieve the toolbox items from.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the toolbox items to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified category and designer host.
category or host is `null`.
Gets the entire collection of toolbox items from the toolbox.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items.
Gets the collection of toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the toolbox items to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCollection"></xref> that contains the current toolbox items that are associated with the specified designer host.
host is `null`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object, which represents a serialized toolbox item, matches the specified attributes.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains the attributes to test the serialized object for.
`true` if the object matches the specified attributes; otherwise, `false`.
serializedObject or filterAttributes is `null`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object, which represents a serialized toolbox item, can be used by the specified designer host.
The object that contains the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> to test for support for the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object is compatible with the specified designer host; otherwise, `false`.
serializedObject or host is `null`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is a serialized toolbox item byusing the specified designer host.
The object to inspect.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is making this request.
`true` if the object contains a toolbox item object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object is a serialized toolbox item.
The object to inspect.
`true` if the object contains a toolbox item object; otherwise, `false`.
Refreshes the state of the toolbox items.
Removes a previously added toolbox item creator of the specified data format.
The data format of the creator to remove.
format is `null`.
Removes a previously added toolbox creator that is associated with the specified data format and the specified designer host.
The data format of the creator to remove.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost"></xref> that is associated with the creator to remove.
format or host is `null`.
Removes the specified toolbox item from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to remove from the toolbox.
toolboxItem is `null`.
Removes the specified toolbox item from the toolbox.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to remove from the toolbox.
The toolbox item category to remove the <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> from.
toolboxItem or category is `null`.

The name of the currently selected category.
Notifies the toolbox service that the selected tool has been used.
Gets a serializable object that represents the specified toolbox item.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to serialize.
An object that represents the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref>.
toolboxItem is `null`.
Sets the current application's cursor to a cursor that represents the currently selected tool.
`true` if the cursor is set by the currently selected tool; `false` if there is no tool selected and the cursor is set to the standard Windows cursor.
Selects the specified toolbox item.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to select.
